The fruits of that convention have been shown by several
large meetings, since held in different places in Texas, in favor of the extension of the Opelousas railroad through that
State, and especially by a Convention held in Trinity, on the
25th of October, by which the substance and spirit of the
above resolutions were emphatically and unanimously re-af-
lirmcd.
The executive committee have also printed, in pamphlet,
an elaborate draft to an Act to provide for the organization
ol corporations, and which was made by the special committee appointed for that duty. This " Act," and a " Memorial to the Legislature," and an " Act to authorize subscriptions," are now in the hands of all the members of said
special committee, for examination and revision, previous to
adoption, as a final report, to be submitted to the Convention
■a January.
